item.title: Code generation with Roslyn
item.description: I recently wrote an answer on StackOverflow.com regarding what I’ve learned doing code generation with Roslyn. My conclusion after a few weeks playing around is that using a combination of inline code snippets (parsed using CSharpSyntaxTree.

item.title: Diagnosing ASP.NET page compilation errors
item.description: Page compilation errors are a common cause of ‘yellow screens of death’ (YSOD) encountered by ASP.NET developers. During the heat of development it’s very easy to ignore the details of these error messages, and instead resolve them with a bit of intuition.

item.title: The Economics of Microsoft Surface
item.description: This is a post I wrote August 2009 but never got around to publishing. Whilst spring cleaning my drafts, I re-read it and decided it wasn’t that bad, so here it is.

item.title: Running uTorrent as a Service on Windows Home Server 2011
item.description: Step 1: Download and Install uTorrent Download uTorrent 2.2.1 (390 KB) Install uTorrent as normal, by opening the downloaded EXE It should install itself into C:\Program Files (x86)\uTorrent [ad#Google Adsense #1]

item.title: Using d:DesignSource for design-time DataGrid grouping with sample data
item.description: I recently had the need to use the row grouping feature of the WPF DataGrid. As you know, in order to design with Blend effectively, you really need to have data displayed at design-time.

item.title: d:DesignInstance in Depth
item.description: Update: I have contacted WPF “User education” team at Microsoft about the lack of documentation. The response was: “I’ve looked into this and there was some confusion around whether or not these were publicly exposed.

item.title: An Auto-Centering Canvas for WPF
item.description: If you try using WPF Canvas to plot objects in a 2d “scene”, you will hit a small problem. The Left and Top dependency properties dictate where the top left corner of your element is positioned.

item.title: Microsoft Surface development goes public
item.description: At PDC this year Microsoft announced that Surface development resources were going to be made publicly available. (Up until now it had been an “invitation only” system).

item.title: WCF Data Services vs WCF RIA Services
item.description: I’ve been having trouble finding a straight forward comparison of these two technologies. On the surface they appear to be solving similar, if not the same problems.

item.title: Expression Blend 3 Help: The missing DelegateCommand class
item.description: Some tutorials from the Expression Blend 3 help docs (e.g. “Try it: Display data from a sample SQL database”, which is based on these two articles) require a class that is present in the ColorSwatch WPF sample.

item.title: Crash when trying to open VS2010 Beta 2 Help: MSHelpListener.exe has stopped working
item.description: Update: There is a Microsoft Connect bug logged for this here. Update 2: “R0b0tz” has got the workaround for this on his blog.

item.title: Update: Ericsson F3507g Mobile Broadband on Windows 7 with Lenovo Thinkpad
item.description: It’s become clear from comments on my previous article, that Lenovo have released a new Windows 7 driver for the Ericsson F3507g Mobile Broadband card.

item.title: Nursing Diagnosis is NOT Software Engineering: Amazon’s crazy book categorization
item.description: I’ve actually noticed this for a few years, but there is something crazy going on with how Amazon.com categorizes its Computer Science/Software books.

item.title: Direct Download Links for SQL Server 2008 Express
item.description: I find it a bit annoying that Microsoft are pushing the Web Platform installer so hard these days that they have removed all obvious direct download links for the various SQL Express packages on the “Express” site.

item.title: How to allow Style tag/element within your WordPress Blog for inline CSS
item.description: If you trust yourself enough to use the <style> tag within your self-hosted WordPress blog then here is how to get them to work:

item.title: Microsoft Expression Web 3 UI Built With WPF; Expression Studio Moves Forward
item.description: A few months ago I asked a question on Somasegar’s blog about the new Expression Web 3, specifically whether the UI would be getting updated to match the rest of the Expression suite.

item.title: SQL Server 2008 Express with Advanced Services does *NOT* include Service Pack 1 (SP1)
item.description: This is a very short post just to say that I spent 10 minutes trying to track down the answer to the question: Does SQL Server 2008 Express with Advanced Services include Service Pack 1?

item.title: Windows 7 ISO: How to easily switch edition
item.description: There have been quite a few blog posts about how to manually switch edition of the Windows 7 ISO, for example to change from Ultimate to Home Premium.

item.title: How to get Ericsson F3507g Mobile Broadband card working on Windows 7 & Lenovo Thinkpad T400s
item.description: Update: A new driver has been released which uses the Windows 7 Mobile Broadband driver framework. Please see my new article.

item.title: Tip for pathping
item.description: This lesser known command line utility, introduced on Windows 2000, is something of a hybrid between ping and tracert. Instead of just determining the path, pathping also sends a barrage of pings to each host along the route.

item.title: Using a telnet client as a port scanner
item.description: If you ever need to check if a TCP port is open or reachable, one easy way to do it is using a telnet client.

item.title: Fix for Windows 7 "random wake from sleep" problem
item.description: For the last few months I’ve had Windows 7 RC installed on two home computers, and both of them have exhibited a strange problem: They would randomly wake from sleep .

item.title: How to make a bootable Vista DVD using MKISOFS/CDRTOOLS
item.description: UPDATE: This is a repost of an old article that is still referenced on some forums. I managed to get hold of an MSDN copy of Vista on DVD.
